> -----Original Message-----
> From: Robert Watkins [mailto:robertdw@...] 
> On Thu, 2003-03-20 at 11:25, Vladimir R. Bossicard wrote:
> > if every test share the same resources, you can potentially 
> have some 
> > very tricky problems:
> > 
> >    your testA screws up one field of your suite
> >    testB.... testY run perfectly
> >    testZ fails
> > 
> > it can be really difficult to discover that testZ was 
> failing because 
> > of testA.
> 
> Hah! That's the easy case. The hard case is when you have 
> testZ _passing_ because of the screw up in testA. At least in 
> the failing case, you've got something to warn you.

These problems can be mitigated by including thorough postcondition and
invariant validation at the end of east test.

-----------------------------
Mike Silverstein
